text:
Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.Programmed cell death is also called as: 
 A. Degeneration 
 B. Calcification 
 C. Apoptosis 
 D. Necrosis 
 E. Atrophy
 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.Which of the following medical condition is because of inherited defect in DNA repair? 
 A. Acanthosis nigricans 
 B. Xeroderma pigmentosum 
 C. Basal cell nevus syndrome 
 D. Bloom syndrome 
 E. Werner syndrome
 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.Which of the following is a pathologic cause of hyperplasia? 
 A. Endometrial hyperplasia 
 B. Compensatory hyperplasia after partial hepatectomy 
 C. Hormonal stimulation seen in breast development at puberty 
 D. Antigenic stimulation seen in lymphoid hyperplasia 
 E. Cardiac muscle in hypertension
 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.In pathology, what is the name given when there is a reversible change of one cell type to another? 
 A. Hyperplasia 
 B. Hypertrophy 
 C. Metaplasia 
 D. Dysplasia 
 E. Atrophy
 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.Which of the following is the best statement for lipofuscin?

 B. Black-brown pigment

 D. Protein

 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.Location of calcifications in interstitial tissues of the stomach, kidneys, lungs, and blood vessels is called as:

 C. Hyaline change

 E. Molluscum contagiosum
 You should generate the output in the following format: "[A/B/C/D/E]. [Reasons]."

Choose the most correct answer and provide the reasons.A 49-year-old woman has hypertension untreated for years. Which of the following cellular alteration will be seen in the myocardium of this patient?

 B. Atrophy

On physical examination the skin of the patient has a bronze color. Which of the following findings will be seen in liver biopsy of this male child?

 E. 47 XY
